title: (x) Pinnacle and technology - DIN Mittelschrift {Yves}
content:
pardon my ignorance on this one... ![.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107095714im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/15160.jpg)

 [‹ Font ID: Modula (not from Emigre)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107095714/http:/www.typophile.com/node/1108 "Go to previous forum topic") [Looking for published examples of Swift (Unger) ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107095714/http:/www.typophile.com/node/1103 "Go to next forum topic")
author: feejee

comments.content:
DIN Mittelschrift, probably [FF DIN](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107095714/http:/www.philsfonts.com/showing.html?sku=FF009467X1P2&start=1) by [Albert-Jan Pool](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107095714/http:/www.philsfonts.com/sresults.html?flag=d&key=keyword&group1field=designer&wagroup1data=Albert-Jan%20Pool).   
   
BTW I'm of the conviction that no-one should ever apologize   
for not knowing something. My moto is:   
_There are no stupid questions, only stupid answers._ ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107095714im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/wink.gif)

thanks Peter.   
and well said regards apologies.

It's _Yves_! I want you to apologize immediately for misusing   
my name! ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107095714im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/biggrin.gif)
